q: But better die than live mechanically a life that is a repetition of repetitions.
h:
“But better die than live mechanically a life that is a repetition of repetitions.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Trust, but verify.
h:
“Trust, but verify.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.
h:
“Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.” —
Vidal Sassoon

q: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
h:
“He is not a lover who does not love forever.” —
Euripides

q: If the happiness and prosperity of other people depend on you, you have nothing to fear anymore.
h:
“If the happiness and prosperity of other people depend on you, you have nothing to fear anymore.” —
Robert Greene

q: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
h:
“Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
h:
“Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.
h:
“Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.” —
Steve Jobs

q: As soon as you truly commit to making something happen, the ?how' will reveal itself.
h:
“As soon as you truly commit to making something happen, the ?how' will reveal itself.” —
Tony Robbins

q: It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.
h:
“It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: No matter how smart we may think we are, no matter how committed we are to our truth, we can lose our way.
h:
“No matter how smart we may think we are, no matter how committed we are to our truth, we can lose our way.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: You can only be afraid of what you think you know.
h:
“You can only be afraid of what you think you know.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
h:
“I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.” —
Richard Bach

q: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
h:
“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.
h:
“The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.” —
James Allen

q: At first dreams seem impossible, then improbable, then inevitable.
h:
“At first dreams seem impossible, then improbable, then inevitable.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
h:
“The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned
h:
“A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
h:
“The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.” —
Mark Twain

q: Confidence is what you have before you understand the problem.
h:
“Confidence is what you have before you understand the problem.” —
Woody Allen

q: When one does not have what one wants, one must want what one has.
h:
“When one does not have what one wants, one must want what one has.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: In a world of change, the learners shall inherit the earth, while the learned shall find themselves perfectly suited for a world that no longer exists.
h:
“In a world of change, the learners shall inherit the earth, while the learned shall find themselves perfectly suited for a world that no longer exists.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution.
h:
“Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.
h:
“A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: What you become is far more important than what you get.
h:
“What you become is far more important than what you get.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Stuff your eyes with wonder... live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
h:
“Stuff your eyes with wonder... live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
h:
“Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.” —
Colin Powell

q: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
h:
“Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them. ” —
Seneca

q: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
h:
“The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph. ” —
George Washington

q: Art is the signature of civilizations.
h:
“Art is the signature of civilizations. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: The less you try to impress, the more peaceful you can be.
h:
“The less you try to impress, the more peaceful you can be.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.
h:
“Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.” —
Rumi

q: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
h:
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Constantly seek criticism. A well thought out critique of whatever you're doing is as valuable as gold.
h:
“Constantly seek criticism. A well thought out critique of whatever you're doing is as valuable as gold.” —
Elon Musk

q: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
h:
“He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.” —
Lao Tzu

q: When a man is penalized for honesty he learns to lie.
h:
“When a man is penalized for honesty he learns to lie.” —
Criss Jami

q: It's only after you've stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.
h:
“It's only after you've stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
h:
“Truth is exact correspondence with reality. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
h:
“Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.” —
Soren Kierkegaard

q: Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.
h:
“Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Creative people are often found either disagreeable or intimidating by mediocrities.
h:
“Creative people are often found either disagreeable or intimidating by mediocrities.” —
Criss Jami

q: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
h:
“Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
h:
“Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying. ” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Life needs to be more than just solving problems every day. You need to wake up and be excited about the future.
h:
“Life needs to be more than just solving problems every day. You need to wake up and be excited about the future.” —
Elon Musk

q: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
h:
“Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect.
h:
“Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect.” —
Euripides

q: A person hears only what they understand.
h:
“A person hears only what they understand.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: We build too many walls and not enough bridges.
h:
“We build too many walls and not enough bridges.” —
Isaac Newton
